intro: Stenomesson breviflorum, commonly known as the narrow-flowered stenomesson, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions such as reduced leaf size and deep root systems. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces achenes as its fruit type. Stenomesson breviflorum is often found in rocky soils and is a component of the local flora in its native range.
